title: How to Perform Puja

steps.headline: Ensure that you have the necessary materials from the things you need section.
Purify yourself with a bath.
steps.description: While bathing, chant the names of the Lord. While ordinary bathing cleans us externally, uttering the name of the Lord purifies our mind, body and soul (trikarana shuddi).

steps.headline: Mark your forehead with a tilaka (urdhva pundra) or bhasma
Light the lamp and place some akshinta along with flowers at the base of the lamp.
Blow the conch (shanka) thrice.
steps.description: Sounding the conch is an auspicious omen that indicates an invitation to God and wards away all evil.

steps.headline: Ring the bell (Ghanti).
steps.description: If you do not have a conch, you may just ring the bell.

steps.headline: Those having an idol, can offer ritualistic worship in the prescribed manner.
steps.description: The others that may not have the time and/or means to do it or have a picture of the Lord in their worship, can do it mentally.

steps.headline: Keep some water in a clean vessel.
Offer water to wash the holy lotus feet (paadhya).
Offer water to wash lotus hands of Lord (arghya).
Offer water for Lord to drink (acamana).
Undress the Lord, or tie a plain white cloth around like a dhoti.
Catch the above 6 items in a bowl, and set aside till the puja is finished
Next, bathe the Lord with the following items in sequence, one after the other:
Clean the Lord and dress Him with clean clothes and ornaments.
Offer flowers to the chanting of mantras.
Light the wicks and show the Arati to the Lord
Offer prayers for forgiveness for any mistakes committed during the puja ceremony)

tyn: Pure water in a clean vessel and a spoon
Uncooked rice grains mixed with turmeric powder (akshata)
Clothing and ornaments to dress the Lord
Consecrated food for offering (cooked rice prasadam or fruit)
Bael leaves if worshipping Lord Shiva
